multer/
lib.rs

1//! An async parser for `multipart/form-data` content-type in Rust.
2//!
3//! It accepts a [`Stream`](futures_util::stream::Stream) of
4//! [`Bytes`](bytes::Bytes), or with the `tokio-io` feature enabled, an
5//! `AsyncRead` reader as a source, so that it can be plugged into any async
6//! Rust environment e.g. any async server.
7//!
8//! # Examples
9//!
10//! ```no_run
11//! use std::convert::Infallible;
12//!
13//! use bytes::Bytes;
14//! // Import multer types.
15//! use futures_util::stream::once;
16//! use futures_util::stream::Stream;
17//! use multer::Multipart;
18//!
19//! #[tokio::main]
20//! async fn main() -> Result<(), Box<dyn std::error::Error>> {
21//!     // Generate a byte stream and the boundary from somewhere e.g. server request body.
22//!     let (stream, boundary) = get_byte_stream_from_somewhere().await;
23//!
24//!     // Create a `Multipart` instance from that byte stream and the boundary.
25//!     let mut multipart = Multipart::new(stream, boundary);
26//!
27//!     // Iterate over the fields, use `next_field()` to get the next field.
28//!     while let Some(mut field) = multipart.next_field().await? {
29//!         // Get field name.
30//!         let name = field.name();
31//!         // Get the field's filename if provided in "Content-Disposition" header.
32//!         let file_name = field.file_name();
33//!
34//!         println!("Name: {:?}, File Name: {:?}", name, file_name);
35//!
36//!         // Process the field data chunks e.g. store them in a file.
37//!         while let Some(chunk) = field.chunk().await? {
38//!             // Do something with field chunk.
39//!             println!("Chunk: {:?}", chunk);
40//!         }
41//!     }
42//!
43//!     Ok(())
44//! }
45//!
46//! // Generate a byte stream and the boundary from somewhere e.g. server request body.
47//! async fn get_byte_stream_from_somewhere(
48//! ) -> (impl Stream<Item = Result<Bytes, Infallible>>, &'static str) {
49//!     let data = "--X-BOUNDARY\r\nContent-Disposition: form-data; \
50//!         name=\"my_text_field\"\r\n\r\nabcd\r\n--X-BOUNDARY--\r\n";
51//!
52//!     let stream = once(async move { Result::<Bytes, Infallible>::Ok(Bytes::from(data)) });
53//!     (stream, "X-BOUNDARY")
54//! }
55//! ```
56//!
57//! ## Prevent Denial of Service (DoS) Attack
58//!
59//! This crate also provides some APIs to prevent potential DoS attacks with
60//! fine grained control. It's recommended to add some constraints
61//! on field (specially text field) size to avoid potential DoS attacks from
62//! attackers running the server out of memory.
63//!
64//! An example:
65//!
66//! ```
67//! use multer::{Constraints, Multipart, SizeLimit};
68//! # use bytes::Bytes;
69//! # use std::convert::Infallible;
70//! # use futures_util::stream::once;
71//!
72//! # async fn run() {
73//! # let data = "--X-BOUNDARY\r\nContent-Disposition: form-data; \
74//! #   name=\"my_text_field\"\r\n\r\nabcd\r\n--X-BOUNDARY--\r\n";
75//! # let some_stream = once(async move { Result::<Bytes, Infallible>::Ok(Bytes::from(data)) });
76//! // Create some constraints to be applied to the fields to prevent DoS attack.
77//! let constraints = Constraints::new()
78//!     // We only accept `my_text_field` and `my_file_field` fields,
79//!     // For any unknown field, we will throw an error.
80//!     .allowed_fields(vec!["my_text_field", "my_file_field"])
81//!     .size_limit(
82//!         SizeLimit::new()
83//!             // Set 15mb as size limit for the whole stream body.
84//!             .whole_stream(15 * 1024 * 1024)
85//!             // Set 10mb as size limit for all fields.
86//!             .per_field(10 * 1024 * 1024)
87//!             // Set 30kb as size limit for our text field only.
88//!             .for_field("my_text_field", 30 * 1024),
89//!     );
90//!
91//! // Create a `Multipart` instance from a stream and the constraints.
92//! let mut multipart = Multipart::with_constraints(some_stream, "X-BOUNDARY", constraints);
93//!
94//! while let Some(field) = multipart.next_field().await.unwrap() {
95//!     let content = field.text().await.unwrap();
96//!     assert_eq!(content, "abcd");
97//! }
98//! # }
99//! # tokio::runtime::Runtime::new().unwrap().block_on(run());
100//! ```
101//!
102//! Please refer [`Constraints`] for more info.
103//!
104//! ## Usage with [hyper.rs](https://hyper.rs/) server
105//!
106//! An [example](https://github.com/rousan/multer-rs/blob/master/examples/hyper_server_example.rs) showing usage with [hyper.rs](https://hyper.rs/).
107//!
108//! For more examples, please visit [examples](https://github.com/rousan/multer-rs/tree/master/examples).
109

137
138/// A Result type often returned from methods that can have `multer` errors.
139pub type Result<T, E = Error> = std::result::Result<T, E>;
140
141/// Parses the `Content-Type` header to extract the boundary value.
142///
143/// # Examples
144///
145/// ```
146/// # fn run(){
147/// let content_type = "multipart/form-data; boundary=ABCDEFG";
148///
149/// assert_eq!(
150///     multer::parse_boundary(content_type),
151///     Ok("ABCDEFG".to_owned())
152/// );
153/// # }
154/// # run();
155/// ```
156pub fn parse_boundary<T: AsRef<str>>(content_type: T) -> Result<String> {
157    let m = content_type
158        .as_ref()
159        .parse::<mime::Mime>()
160        .map_err(crate::Error::DecodeContentType)?;
161
162    if !(m.type_() == mime::MULTIPART && m.subtype() == mime::FORM_DATA) {
163        return Err(crate::Error::NoMultipart);
164    }
165
166    m.get_param(mime::BOUNDARY)
167        .map(|name| name.as_str().to_owned())
168        .ok_or(crate::Error::NoBoundary)
169}
170
171#[cfg(test)]
172mod tests {
173    use super::*;
174
175    #[test]
176    fn test_parse_boundary() {
177        let content_type = "multipart/form-data; boundary=ABCDEFG";
178        assert_eq!(parse_boundary(content_type), Ok("ABCDEFG".to_owned()));
179
180        let content_type = "multipart/form-data; boundary=------ABCDEFG";
181        assert_eq!(parse_boundary(content_type), Ok("------ABCDEFG".to_owned()));
182
183        let content_type = "boundary=------ABCDEFG";
184        assert!(parse_boundary(content_type).is_err());
185
186        let content_type = "text/plain";
187        assert!(parse_boundary(content_type).is_err());
188
189        let content_type = "text/plain; boundary=------ABCDEFG";
190        assert!(parse_boundary(content_type).is_err());
191    }
192}
